1479656311792955393.text:
Fixed a small bug in my day 5 project.

The keyboard shortcuts `ctrl k` and `cmd k` are working fine on macOS.

However, pressing `ctrl k` on Windows by default will trigger Google Search in Chrome browser.
So I need to call e.preventDefault() to prevent that 😅

#100DaysOfCode https://t.co/XaoM3DUAXu

Could someone let me know if I did it correctly? 😅

1483838036618379264.text:
day 13 of #100DaysOfCode 

Learned about Yarn workspaces and start using it in my repo.

I deliberately use TailwindCSS as dependencies for day 4 to 7 to see how Yarn workspaces can save some disk space.

The result is truly impressive!

However, day 13 project is still WIP. https://t.co/rWwRIhdbGE

1484210201456967687.text:
day 14 of #100DaysOfCode 

Continued from day 13, created a Slack-like sidebar navigation and persist selected tab in localStorage.
Always wanted to create something like this.

Next, try to make the sidebar width resizable and implement double-click to restore to original width. https://t.co/ipxFhZ6Wn5

demo: https://t.co/5uMQD7Xggu
src: https://t.co/4Xg26G9EuC

Would love to hear some feedback.

#100DaysOfCode #JavaScript

It's still WIP. I'll share the link soon!

1487456993510313984.text:
day 21 of #100DaysOfCode 

Continued my GitHub pinned repo clone. (part 3)

Had some issues when styling web components.
Decided to deviate from the main task (dnd) to give Svelte a try for the first time.

So far, I'm impressed by its template syntax and great DX.

TODO for tomorrow:
- fetch GitHub repository data from API
- fix minor CSS issues
- finish drag and drop logic 😅
- put Svelte project in Yarn workspaces

#100DaysOfCode
forgot to put the screenshots #100DaysOfCode https://t.co/oo8IOhhHtC

1488204053360222211.text:
day 22 of #100DaysOfCode 

With the help of dragula, I managed to make my GitHub pinned repo drag and drop functionality work.

Thanks to livereload plugin, I sent too many requests to GitHub.
Somehow, I got HTTP 403 instead of 429 😅.

TODO
- CSS
- refactor data fetching code https://t.co/KWl5UaOkEw

One thing that's a bit annoying is dropping area/sensitivity in dragula.

Comparing this to the reference GitHub pinned repo dnd, my version was less sensitive when I'm dragging one repo to the drop zone.

I'm figuring out how to adjust this.

#100DaysOfCode

1489282216341704713.text:
day 25 of #100DaysOfCode 

Re-learning Twitter APIs.
Still failing with "Client Forbidden" error 😭

I was trying to get list of my own tweets to build #100DaysOfCode tracker.

After reading more Twitter API docs, seems like I don't have the access to full-archive search endpoint.
Luckily, I can still use user Tweet timeline endpoint.

With correct tweet.fields, I think I can pull data I need from the Twitter API. 🔥

#100DaysOfCode https://t.co/y7fzUeGhYG

1492542355291140096.text:
day 33 of #100DaysOfCode

1492906023442874369.text:
day 34 of #100DaysOfCode

Trying to make the behavior of keyboard navigation similar to Twitter, where going up/down would keep the "focused" tweet on top of the list.

Found that I need to compute getBoundingClientRect of the focused item and its scrollable parent element. https://t.co/EUIKNcGJWq

Also need to take padding into account.

#100DaysOfCode https://t.co/Hoy10rorEK

1493268793413758977.text:
day 35 of #100DaysOfCode

Implement highlighted text in my tracker project. Currently, it's just a regular expression to match the day pattern.
Learned about <mark> HTML element and white-space: pre-wrap in CSS. https://t.co/cnNYtAndEx

1493630336731062273.text:
day 36 of #100DaysOfCode 

Fixed a bug in data processing script for my tracker project.
I just found that the order of reply tweets are out of place. 😅

Before and after (notice the reply tweet at day 34).

In each conversation, reply tweets should be under the top-level tweet and sorted by created_at field (oldest first).
I use OrderedDict in Python to solve this.

#100DaysOfCode https://t.co/Q2Kg3EmNTR

1493993549503025155.text:
day 37 of #100DaysOfCode 

Small improvements to the tracker project.
- Added month legend to the activity graph.
- Update tooltip text to include tweets count.

I learned that I need to use document.createElementNS instead of document.createElement to create an svg element. https://t.co/PZU2FnNfh3

1494354066734202880.text:
day 38 of #100DaysOfCode 

Deployed my #100DaysOfCode tracker to Vercel!
Working on the build scheduling with GitHub actions.

Need to work on a different project for tomorrow.
Will continue this project when I started round 2 of #100DaysOfCode 😉

1494709351227228165.text:
day 39 of #100DaysOfCode

Instead of starting new projects, I could learn different things from keep building my progress tracker project.

Here's my plan in Notion note.

If everything works as planned, I should see the new update (tweets from this conversation) deployed automatically to this URL soon https://t.co/RUdHzhtdjW

🥰

#100DaysOfCode

The scheduled workflow did work 🎉

With an acceptable delay (~10 minutes).

#100DaysOfCode https://t.co/warPTXTVd1
